hints.content:
$148 = 754 -{\goldE{?}}$

![A number line with 2 points labeled. An arrow from point 754 back to point 148 is labeled, minus question mark.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0f622f93740f292bcbb643af131106685660a31d)

Let's start by subtracting hundreds from ${754}$ until we get as close to  ${148}$ as possible without going below ${148}$.

$\begin{align}
{754} -\purpleD{100}=654\\\\
{654} -\purpleD{100}= 554\\\\
{554} -\purpleD{100}= 454\\\\
{454} -\purpleD{100}= 354\\\\
{354} -\purpleD{100}= 254\\\\
{254} -\purpleD{100}= 154
\end{align}$

If we subtract $\purpleD{6 \text{ hundreds}}$, or $\purpleD{6 00}$, we reach $154$. We cannot subtract any more hundreds without going below ${148}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 754 back to a new point 154 labeled, "minus 600"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/69c16a6135a6bfaaec7d5cd97f2aa7b89f0ada09)

Next, let's subtract tens from $154$ until we get as close to  ${148}$ as possible without going below ${148}$.

We cannot subtract any tens without going below ${148}$.

Finally, how many ones should we subtract from $154$ to get to  ${148}?$

$\begin{align}
154-\greenD{4} &= 150\\\\
150-\greenD{2} &= 148
\end{align}$

We subtract $\greenD{6\text{ ones}}$.

![The same number line, with an arrow from point 154 back to point 148 labeled, "minus 6"](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/98ed42851444e91a954e7fde5527fe2f656cc698)

We subtracted $\purpleD{6 \text{ hundreds}}$ and $\greenD{6\text{ ones}}$ from ${754}$ to get to ${148}$.

$\purpleD{6 00}+\greenD{6}=\goldE{606}$

![The number line with all of the arrows shown. The original arrow from point 754 to point 148 is labeled, "minus 606." The arrows spans the arrows labeled "minus 600," "minus 00," and "minus 6."](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0331ea743a254165a5bd98d019a230438658c11b)
